/admin/development/logger.tpl:
Logger Settings

By enabling the check boxes, you will receive logs to your terminal. If you specify a path, logs will then be saved to a file instead. HTTP logging is useful for collecting statistics about who, when, and what people access on your forum. In addition to logging HTTP requests, we can also log socket.io events. Socket.io logging, in combination with redis-cli monitor, can be very helpful for learning NodeBB's internals.


Simply check/uncheck the logging settings to enable or disable logging on the fly. No restart needed.






Heap Snapshot
Logger Control Panel

/admin/manage/category.tpl:
• Category Settings
  • Privileges






You can configure the access control privileges for this category in this section. Privileges can be granted on a per-user or a per-group basis. You can add a new user to this table by searching for them in the form below.

Note: Privilege settings take effect immediately. It is not necessary to save the category after adjusting these settings.

{function.spawnPrivilegeStates, privileges.users.username, privileges}
User {privileges.labels.users.name}
{privileges.users.username}
No user-specific privileges in this category.
{function.spawnPrivilegeStates, name, privileges}
Group {privileges.labels.groups.name}
{privileges.groups.name}
No group-specific privileges in this category.
If the registered-users group is granted a specific privilege, all other groups receive an implicit privilege, even if they are not explicitly defined/checked. This implicit privilege is shown to you because all users are part of the registered-users user group, and so, privileges for additional groups need not be explicitly granted.

/admin/plugins/emailer-mailgun.tpl:
Emailer (Mailgun)

Mailgun is a programmable email platform. It allows your application to become a fully featured email server. Send, receive and track messages with ease using your favorite programming language.

Imagination is your limit. Email is not hard anymore.

To get started:

  1. Register for an account on http://mailgun.com. Mailgun offers a free tier with up to 10,000 free emails monthly.
  2. (Optional) Set up a custom domain at https://mailgun.com/cp/domains/new
  3. Paste your API key (not your public key) into the field below, hit save, and restart your NodeBB
/admin/plugins/write-api.tpl:
Write API Settings

JSON Web Tokens are an open, industry standard RFC 7519 method for representing claims securely between two parties. To make requests with a JSON Web Token instead of a user/master token, sign the entire request payload with the same secret as defined in the plugin, and either send it in the POST body, or as a query string parameter. In both cases, the key `token` is used.

Active Tokens
User/Token
Master Tokens
Token

Master tokens differ from regular write-enabled tokens in that they can be utilised to make any API call as any user.

To define a user in your call, add the _uid parameter to your request body.

API Documentation
{documentation}
/admin/plugins/emoji-extended.tpl:
Emoji Extended Settings
/^[\s\S]*(
):/i
Note: The Feature of custom images isn't implemented (yet).
By disabling above checkbox you ensure no automatic changes within the node_modules/nodebb-plugin-emoji-extended/emoji/ directory. Therefor you may change the images located there and the !index.list file in order to setup your own images.
This will disable the categorization of emoji within the composer-dialog.
Take care not to update this plugin afterwards without a backup.
Action Panel
/admin/plugins/markdown.tpl:
Markdown
Code Formatting
Danger Zone
Careful!

Automatic HTML sanitization is an important part of ensuring that your users do not run arbitrary javascript or alter parts of the page that were not meant to be altered. If this option is checked, beware the consequences!

Markdown Control Panel
/admin/plugins/pushbullet.tpl:
Pushbullet Notifications

Allows NodeBB to interface with the Pushbullet service in order to provide push notifications to user mobile phones.

  1. Install and activate this plugin.
  2. Register an application via the Pushbullet website, and obtain a client key and secret.

    In particular, the redirect_uri should be your forum's URL with /pushbullet/auth appended to it (e.g. {url}/pushbullet/auth)

  3. Enter the client key and secret into the configuration block below, and save.
  4. Reload NodeBB.
Users Associated with Pushbullet {numAssoc}
Pushbullet Control Panel
